title: Software Engineering Manager
impacts: Direct 100% remote software team. Oversee all daily activities and long-range planning. Including engineering and quality roles.

Responsible for the full talent lifecycle, from recruiting and interviewing to onboarding, retention, coaching, promotions, salary increases, conducting regular one-on-one meetings, performance reviews, career development, and accountability for all team members.
Revitalized team dynamics by strategically offboarding underperforming members and strategically recruiting high-caliber talent, resulting in a more efficient and productive team.
Plan and execute product delivery by interfacing with senior leadership, product management, and users.
Increased team velocity by improving our way of working, partnering with product management to improve the backlog, and challenging the team to intelligently push themselves to greater productivity.

title: Software Engineering Manager
reasonLeaving: The startup declared bankruptcy and closed.
impacts: Led and managed multiple globally distributed software teams, overseeing daily operations and long-term strategic planning. Responsibilities included guiding engineering, quality, and DevOps roles.

Responsible for the full talent lifecycle, from recruiting and interviewing to onboarding, retention, coaching, promotions, salary increases, conducting regular one-on-one meetings, performance reviews, career development, and accountability for all team members.
Successfully orchestrated product delivery by collaborating with senior leadership, product management, sales, and customers, ensuring seamless execution.
Pioneered the implementation of an Agile process, introducing structure and efficiency where none existed, contributing to the organization's maturity.
Fostered synergy between Product Management and engineering teams, establishing a harmonious working relationship that improved product development.
Played a key role on the 'Ghost Team', a human resource steering committee, actively contributing to the development and refinement of the annual review procedure.
Achieved the successful delivery of two mission-critical, high-visibility products to production through effective team leadership and project management.
Significantly increased engineer retention by proactively addressing concerns and fostering a more positive team environment upon joining the organization.
Demonstrated a rapid ability to grasp blockchain concepts and gain deep product knowledge, enhancing overall effectiveness in the role.

title: Software Engineering Manager
reasonLeaving: I desired to work again in a product company.
impacts: Managed a diverse, US-based development team that combines remote and hybrid work arrangements, overseeing both engineering and quality roles.

Responsible for the full talent life cycle, including recruitment, interviewing, hiring, onboarding, retention strategies, coaching, facilitating promotions, managing salary increases, conducting one-on-one meetings, performance reviews, and actively supporting team members' career development.
Orchestrated and executed product deliveries by closely collaborating with senior leadership, product management, sales, customers, and vendors, ensuring seamless project execution.
Successfully reinstated Agile processes that were temporarily shelved during the COVID-19 pandemic, reestablishing a structured and efficient workflow.
Played a pivotal role in promoting and mentoring a highly skilled senior engineer to the company's first Application Architect position, demonstrating commitment to internal talent development.
Spearheaded the promotion and mentoring of the company's first-ever DevSecOps Engineer, strengthening the organization's security and operational capabilities.
Promoted and mentored the company's first Automation Test Engineer, enhancing product quality and testing procedures.
Directly managed and mentored an intern from a school program, providing valuable guidance and hands-on experience.
Spearheaded the recruitment of the company's first Digital Product Manager, enhancing product development and management capabilities.

Made significant contributions to the development of a request for proposal and the finalization of a contract with a consulting firm for a substantial, two-year project, showcasing strong project management skills.
Rescued a challenging off-shore/on-shore software project by effectively setting expectations with the vendor and ultimately delivering a successful web application and mobile application.
Actively participated as a member of the company's Inclusion, Diversity, Equity, and Access (I.D.E.A.) team, contributing to a more inclusive and equitable workplace.

title: Software Engineering Manager
reasonLeaving: Pandemic losses caused major force reduction.
impacts: Managed a remote software team based in the United States, overseeing engineering, quality, and DevOps roles.

Responsible for the entire talent life cycle, encompassing recruitment, interviewing, hiring, onboarding, retention, coaching, promotions, salary adjustments, one-on-one sessions, performance evaluations, career development, and ensuring accountability across all team members.
Strategically planned and executed product deliveries, collaborating closely with senior leadership, product management, sales, and valued customers.
Undertook a pivotal role upon joining the company, tasked with transforming the software development practice, which had been informally labeled as 'the wild west' by the CEO.

Spearheaded a cultural shift in engineering by strategically expanding the team with essential roles, including Senior Developers, Test Automation Engineers, and DevOps Engineers. This transformation involved the implementation of Agile processes and policies, encompassing practices such as GitFlow, code repository management, software testing, project estimation, project management, data security, code reviews, daily scrums, retrospectives, and more.
Demonstrated hands-on skills by personally designing and developing a time-sensitive ReSTful API for payment processing, preserving a critical customer relationship.
Oversaw and actively participated in the design, development, and successful delivery of a modern web-based merchant portal, leveraging cutting-edge frameworks.

Pioneered an initiative to decompose an outdated, legacy monolithic gateway into micro-services, contributing to architecture and development. Unfortunately, this initiative was halted due to the pandemic-related reduction in force.
Orchestrated and led the annual PMN Development Conference, a noteworthy in-person gathering of the team, fostering knowledge sharing and collaboration.

title: Software Engineering Manager
impacts: Led a dynamic software team with primarily U.S.-based members, collaborating with a System Architect located overseas.

Managed the complete talent life cycle, including recruitment, interviewing, hiring, onboarding, retention strategies, coaching, overseeing promotions, salary adjustments, conducting one-on-one meetings, performance evaluations, actively supporting career development, and ensuring accountability for all team members.
Orchestrated and executed product deliveries through effective collaboration with senior leadership, product management, sales, and valued customers.
Introduced streamlined onboarding procedures to expedite team members' integration, enabling rapid assimilation into their roles.

Established and implemented policies and processes related to code reviews, unit testing, design work, documentation, code ownership, and work estimation, enhancing overall software quality and development efficiency.
Collaborated closely with the Scrum Master to refine processes related to sprint cadence and other Scrum ceremonies, contributing to improved workflow and project management practices.

title: Executive Vice President, Software Engineering
reasonLeaving: The startup declared bankruptcy and closed.
impacts: Managed both a software team and a creative digital experience team (video designers, copy writers, UI/UX designers) responsible for the lifecycle of digital marketing experiences.

Responsible for the complete talent life cycle, including recruitment, interviewing, hiring, onboarding, retention strategies, coaching, promotions, salary adjustments, one-on-one meetings, performance evaluations, active support for career development, and ensuring accountability for all team members.
Strategically planned and executed product deliveries by collaborating closely with senior leadership, product management, sales, and valued customers.
Fostered improved collaboration and rapport between the software engineering and creative teams, resulting in accelerated delivery of digital marketing campaigns.
Introduced and managed a Kanban-style process for the teams to enhance their work management and efficiency.
Demonstrated hands-on expertise by both writing and reviewing code for ReSTful APIs and digital marketing experiences, ensuring the highest standards of quality and performance.

Devised and executed comprehensive policies and procedures to ensure the successful development of digital marketing applications. These encompassed the entire development lifecycle, including planning, resource allocation, scheduling, tools selection, creative ideation, design comps, requirements gathering, iterative reviews, client feedback integration, development, rigorous testing, seamless deployment, ongoing support, and efficient campaign management.
Spearheaded the integration of new tools, such as Jira, Cloudinary, and Time Tracking, into the development process, enhancing workflow efficiency and project management capabilities.

Pioneered the implementation of a company-wide biannual employee performance review policy, providing employees with timely and constructive retrospectives on their work and career goals. This initiative ensured that performance evaluations were consistently and effectively conducted across the organization, promoting professional growth and development.

title: Senior Scrum Master
reasonLeaving: I desired to return to team leadership and management.
impacts: Oversee Agile processes, ceremonies, and delivery for multiple software teams.

Established a Kanban-style implementation in an Agile-challenged environment. Worked closely with product owners, engineers, testers, technical writers, requirements analysts, and project managers to increase workflow and visibility into the workflow.
Established a product roadmap view to provide SVP of Engineering with a view into the roadmap and progress.
Assisted with the formation of the “Agile Practices Guild” which was a regular gathering of Agile enthusiasts to discuss practices and team up on challenges.

Using spare time, personally developed the proof-of-concept version of the National Channel Service web application. The intention was to pioneer the use of AngularJS, and to prove the concept of the service.

Using spare time, I developed a web application (AngularJs) to mine the Jira API for data to display sprint progress and statistics in a different manner. The application was used as the focus of our daily stand-up meetings.

title: Senior Software Engineer > Project Manager > Director of Software Engingeering
impacts: Designed and developed key service, interface and library components for mission-critical, high-throughput .NET SOA solutions - including a Security Token Service.
Designed and implemented mission-critical databases. Emphasis on data integrity, index lifecycle and data lifecycle.
Manage project workflows from inception to delivery.
Manage software engineers and testers in daily activities.

Successfully project managed and delivered a mission-critical project on a “the company will not survive if delivered late” deadline. This made me the project manager of choice for difficult projects.

In a chaotic environment without much process, as a voice calling for improvements and professionalism, I was offered the role of project manager so that I would have the influence and authority necessary to implement processes and policies.
Promoted to Director, Product Development.
Implemented SQL partitioning scheme to alleviate critical application under-performance.

title: Junior Software Engineer > Senior Software Engineer
impacts: Design, write, and review software code for desktop and server.
Design, write, and review SQL database structures.
Promoted to Senior Software Engineer from Junior Software Engineer.
Lead engineer on the company’s very first .NET project.
